Module org.microbean.type
Package org.microbean.type

Class Type.VariantSemantics

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics
org.microbean.type.Type.VariantSemantics
Direct Known Subclasses:
Type.CdiSemantics, Type.CovariantSemantics, Type.InvariantSemantics
Enclosing class:
Type<T>
@Experimental public abstract static class Type.VariantSemantics extends Type.Semantics
An abstract partial Type.Semantics that permits subtyping.
Author:
Laird Nelson

  • Method Details

    • classIsAssignableFromClass

      protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromClass(Type<X> receiverClass, Type<Y> payloadClass)
      Returns true if and only if a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied payloadClass is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied receiverClass, according to the assignability rules modeled by this Type.Semantics instance, and if and only if payloadClass models a Java class and not any other type, and if and only if receiverClass models a Java class and not any other type.

      This method is called by the Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type) method.

      This implementation returns true if and only if receiverClass.supertype(payloadClass) returns true.

      Overrides:
      classIsAssignableFromClass in class Type.Semantics
      Type Parameters:
      X - the kind of type modeled by the receiverClass; often a java.lang.reflect.Type
      Y - the kind of type modeled by the payloadClass; often a java.lang.reflect.Type
      Parameters:
      receiverClass - the receiver type as described above; must not be null
      payloadClass - the payload type as described above; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if receiverClass.supertypeOf(payloadClass) returns true
      See Also:
      • Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType

      protected final <X, Y> boolean genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(Type<X> receiverGenericArrayType, Type<Y> payloadGenericArrayType)
      Returns true if and only if a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied payloadGenericArrayType is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied receiverGenericArrayType, according to the assignability rules modeled by this Type.Semantics instance, and if and only if payloadGenericArrayType models a generic array type and not any other type, and if and only if receiverGenericArrayType models a generic array type and not any other type.

      This method is called by the Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type) method.

      This implementation returns true if and only if the component type of the receiverGenericArrayType is assignable from the component type of the payloadGenericArrayType.

      Overrides:
      genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType in class Type.Semantics
      Type Parameters:
      X - the kind of type modeled by the receiverGenericArrayType; often a java.lang.reflect.Type
      Y - the kind of type modeled by the payloadClass; often a java.lang.reflect.Type
      Parameters:
      receiverGenericArrayType - the receiver type as described above; must not be null
      payloadGenericArrayType - the payload type as described above; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if the component type of the receiverGenericArrayType is assignable from the component type of the payloadGenericArrayType
      See Also:
      • Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
